page.title: 10DYKE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The church in Dyke was built in 1781 and is positioned on a hill about the middle of the village.Although the church was built in 1781 there was a church there since the eleventh century.There was another church just outside Dyke,now used for storage,which was the united free church.In 1929 the two churches joined although it was not until 1941 that the congregations united.In the Dyke Church roll are 182 people, 65 people who regularly come on Sunday worship and 16 elders.There are 6 organisations connected with the church which are Creche,womens guild,badminton club, youth fellowship,bible class and Sunday School.The Sunday School has about 15-20 children who attend regularly
